item.title: Interacting Python and R
item.description: library(reticulate) import re string1="" re.findall(r'A[ATCG]TAAT', string1) ## ['ATTAAT', 'ACTAAT'] re.findall(r'GC[AG][AT]TG', string1) ## ['GCGTTG', 'GCAATG'] This code matches restriction enzyme binding sites ANTAAT and GCRWTG. Note that per the IUPAC nucleotide code, N is any base, R is A or G, W is A or T. #split nucleotide sequence into individual vectors nuc_vector<-strsplit(py$string1, "")[[1]] #count frequency of each base table(strsplit(py$string1, "")[[1]]) ## ## A C G T ## 501 507 508 496 This code results in the the total frequencies of each base in string 1, not accounting for the bases that code for multiple bases(e.
